results.title: Nobody will speak of us when we are dead = Nadie hablara de nosotras cuando hayamos muerto [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Agustin Diaz Yanes, Edmundo Gil Casas, Flamenco Films SA, Renin and Xaloc SA
results.brief_description:
Gloria turns to prostitution to support her alcohol addiction after her bullfighter husband is seriously injured. We first see Gloria on the job for a group of Mexican money launderers. Things go awry when one of the clients, an undercover DEA agent is murdered. Gloria is the only witness, and after a pique of generosity, is handed a list of contacts in Spain. Eventually deported, Gloria returns to Madrid, contacts in hand, to the home of her mother-in-law and invalid husband determined to start a new life but is pursued by one of the hitmen. An interesting subplot involves his daughter’s illness exacerbated by her father’s profession, seemingly as an act of God. Hailed as a Spanish “Pulp fiction”, “Nobody will speak of us when we’re dead” received the 1995 Goya Award for Best Picture. In Spanish with English subtitles.
Cast includes: Victoria Abril, Pilar Bardem, Federico Luppi

results.title: Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Bill Justice, Walt Disney and Disney Educational Productions
results.brief_description: An updated version of the old story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is done in an inventive three-dimensional animation technique that will be special interest to film study classes.

results.title: Noah's ark
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Stephen Jones and Babelsberg International Film Produktion
results.brief_description: Australia provides the backdrop for this loose retelling of the eternal story of biblical hero Noah (Jon Voight), the great flood that destroyed the world, and the ark that was built by Noah and his family and housed two of every animal species. This made for television movie was not well received by critics, despite its international cast of Jon Voight, Mary Steenburgen and F. Murray Abraham.

results.title: Kama sutra: a tale of love
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Lydia Dean Pilcher, Mirabai Films, NDF International, Pandora Films and Pony Canyon
results.brief_description: Centred on the text The Kama Sutra this is a film about class and politics in sixteenth century India - a lush melodrama, featuring explicit sexual posturing. Initially it is the story of two women: Maya, a rebellious servant girl and Tara her mistress and future queen, childhood friends who become adult rivals. Publicly humiliated during Tara’s nuptial celebrations, a vengeful Maya seduces the king prior to his wedding night. Consequently Maya is spurned and turned out into the street, despite the king’s burgeoning obsession for her. Maya has an affair with a sculptor of erotic deities, before training as a courtesan, returning to the palace as a professional seductress. Meanwhile the king has fallen into an opium addled, hedonistic stupor that threatens the future of the kingdom. Mira Nair’s (Mississippi Masala, Salaam Bombay!, Monsoon Wedding) film operates as a critique of the class system and is a tract about self-determination and sexual politics, but it is overwhelmed by a simplistic script and predictable character developments. Nair may have been reaching for a feminist interpretation of the classic erotic text, as well as a narrative about spiritual awakening, but the key joys here are the rich colourful palette and exotic setting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mira Nair, Lydia Dean Pilcher, Mirabai Films, NDF International, Pandora Films and Pony Canyon

results.title: Jalan jalan: a journey in Sudanese Java
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a film without commentary but with all the sights and sounds, colour and tempo of life of the exotic Indonesian islands in the Java Sea. Here Jalan, Jalan can mean either going on a journey or simply taking a stroll. It is a film full of surprises in the bustling half-modern, half-ancient city of Jakarta, capital of the island republic, and in the lovely countryside. (An abridged and revised version of ‘Wet Earth and Warm People’ made for younger audiences.)

results.title: Jakob Gimpel, pianist: program No. 17
results.creator_credit: Paul Gordon, George Moskov and Official Films
results.brief_description: A Frederic Chopin recital performed by Polish-American pianist, Jakob Gimpel, featuring “Etude in E Major” (Opus 10, No. 3), “Waltz in C Sharp Minor” (Opus 64, No. 2) and “Mazurka in B Flat Major” (Opus 7, No. 1). Arranged by Roy Douglas into the ballet “Le Sylphide”.

results.title: Dance me to my song
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Giuseppe Pedersoli, Fandango, Intra Films, Smile Productions and Vertigo Productions
results.brief_description: de Heer’s seventh feature addresses issues of obligation, accountability, need and love, through the conflicted relationship between a severely physically disabled young woman, Julia, and her abusive, short-tempered and lonely carer, Madelaine. Like Heather Rose, the actor inflicted with cerebral palsy that plays her, Julia is confined to a wheelchair and is able to communicate only through a voice-synthesizer. Nevertheless, much to Madelaine’s chagrin, she succeeds in developing a close friendship with Eddie, a man she meets on the street. But Julia wants love and sex, not just companionship, and the two women become locked in a battle for Eddie’s attentions. Rose’s participation in the film, both as its lead and as a co-writer, and the unflinching focus on the minutiae of her labourous and painful daily routine, brings it into the realm of documentary. As in his earlier films ‘Bad Boy Bubby’ and ‘The Quiet Room’, de Heer again focuses on a central character who succeeds in battling against totally inconceivable odds to overcome their victimhood. Cast includes: Heather Rose, Joey Kennedy, John Brumpton, Rena Owen.

results.title: Dance crazy in Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Robert Kuperberg, Gerard Paquet, Clara Films and RM Arts
results.brief_description: A collection of cinematic excerpts along with interviews with Hermes Pan, choreographer extraordinaire who created many of the most memorable musical dance moments in the era of the major Hollywood musicals. The film is a biographical study of Pan’s entry into the world of dance, his arrival in Hollywood, and his work with a variety of filmmakers, actors and dancers. Ultimately, it is also a tribute to his contribution to musical film history as the documentary was completed very shortly before his death. Also featuring discussion about and footage of dance greats such as Fred Astaire, Ginger Rogers, Rita Hayworth, Kim Novak, Bob Fosse, Ann Miller, Carol Haney, Elizabeth Taylor, Cyd Charisse and Hermes Pan himself in rare motion picture appearances, the documentary is a personalised insight into the Hollywood musical era with reflective commentary from Pan in the presentation of its archival contents.
